quotes.quote: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.quote: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
quotes.author: Margaret Mead

quotes.quote: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Life isn’t about getting and having, it’s about giving and being.
quotes.author: Kevin Kruse

quotes.quote: Whatever the mind of man can conceive and believe, it can achieve.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.quote: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote: I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took any excuse.
quotes.author: Florence Nightingale

quotes.quote: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
quotes.author: Wayne Gretzky

quotes.quote: I’ve missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I’ve lost almost 300 games. 26 times I’ve been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I’ve failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
quotes.author: Michael Jordan

quotes.quote: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.
quotes.author: Amelia Earhart

quotes.quote: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.quote: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: An unexamined life is not worth living.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.quote: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched — they must be felt with the heart.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
quotes.author: Anne Frank

quotes.quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: The only thing that stands between you and your dream is the will to try and the belief that it is actually possible.
quotes.author: Joel Brown

quotes.quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: What’s money? A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and goes to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.
quotes.author: Bob Dylan

quotes.quote: I didn’t fail the test. I just found 100 ways to do it wrong.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: In order to succeed, your desire for success should be greater than your fear of failure.
quotes.author: Bill Cosby

quotes.quote: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The person who says it cannot be done should not interrupt the person who is doing it.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: There are no traffic jams along the extra mile.
quotes.author: Roger Staubach

quotes.quote: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: You become what you believe.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Life is what we make it, always has been, always will be.
quotes.author: Grandma Moses

quotes.quote: The question isn’t who is going to let me; it’s who is going to stop me.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: It’s not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
quotes.author: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.quote: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
quotes.author: Peter Drucker

quotes.quote: The only way out is through.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote: The only thing that is constant is change.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: I try to create sympathy for my characters, then turn the monsters loose.
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.quote: Prose is architecture, not interior decoration.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: It's none of their business that you have to learn to write. Let them think you were born that way.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: Most writers regard the truth as their most valuable possession, and therefore are most economical in its use.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: And as imagination bodies forth the forms of things unknown, the poet's pen turns them to shapes and gives to airy nothing a local habitation and a name.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare (from A Midsummer Night’s Dream)

quotes.quote: If you can tell stories, create characters, devise incidents, and have sincerity and passion, it doesn't matter a damn how you write.
quotes.author: Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: To produce a mighty book, you must choose a mighty theme.
quotes.author: Herman Melville

quotes.quote: It is perfectly okay to write garbage as long as you edit brilliantly.
quotes.author: C. J. Cherryh

quotes.quote: It took me fifteen years to discover I had no talent for writing, but I couldn't give it up because by that time I was too famous.
quotes.author: Robert Benchley

quotes.quote: Any man who keeps working is not a failure. He may not be a great writer, but if he applies the old-fashioned virtues of hard, constant labor, he'll eventually make some kind of career for himself as writer.
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.quote: A blank piece of paper is God's way of telling us how hard it to be God.
quotes.author: Sidney Sheldon

quotes.quote: Not that the story need be long, but it will take a long while to make it short.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: If you have other things in your life-family, friends, good productive day work,these can interact with your writing and the sum will be all the richer.
quotes.author: David Brin

quotes.quote: My own experience is that once a story has been written, one has to cross out the beginning and the end. It is there that we authors do most of our lying.
quotes.author: Anton Chekhov

quotes.quote: I have been successful probably because I have always realized that I knew nothing about writing and have merely tried to tell an interesting story entertainingly.
quotes.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs

quotes.quote: First, find out what your hero wants, then just follow him!
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.quote: Most of the basic material a writer works with is acquired before the age of fifteen.
quotes.author: Willa Cather

quotes.quote: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams

quotes.quote: Words are a lens to focus one's mind.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: Poetry creates the myth, the prose writer draws its portrait.
quotes.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.quote: A writer without interest or sympathy for the foibles of his fellow man is not conceivable as a writer.
quotes.author: Joseph Conrad

quotes.quote: Science fiction writers, I am sorry to say, really do not know anything.
quotes.author: Philip K. Dick

quotes.quote: The only thing I was fit for was to be a writer, and this notion rested solely on my suspicion that I would never be fit for real work, and that writing didn't require any.
quotes.author: Russell Baker

quotes.quote: Half my life is an act of revision.
quotes.author: John Irving

quotes.quote: People on the outside think there's something magical about writing, that you go up in the attic at midnight and cast the bones and come down in the morning with a story, but it isn't like that. You sit in back of the typewriter and you work, and that's all there is to it.
quotes.author: Harlan Ellison

quotes.quote: People do not deserve to have good writing, they are so pleased with bad.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: I went for years not finishing anything. Because, of course, when you finish something you can be judged.
quotes.author: Erica Jong

quotes.quote: Don't try to figure out what other people want to hear from you; figure out what you have to say. It's the one and only thing you have to offer.
quotes.author: Barbara Kingsolver

quotes.quote: A word is dead when it is said, some say. I say it just begins to live that day.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.quote: Writing a novel is like driving a car at night. You can only see as far as your headlights, but you can make the whole trip that way.
quotes.author: E. L. Doctorow

quotes.quote: Get it down. Take chances. It may be bad, but it's the only way you can do anything really good.
quotes.author: William Faulkner

quotes.quote: I am irritated by my own writing. I am like a violinist whose ear is true, but whose fingers refuse to reproduce precisely the sound he hears within.
quotes.author: Gustave Flaubert

quotes.quote: There's no money in poetry, but then there's no poetry in money either.
quotes.author: Robert Graves

quotes.quote: It is the writer who might catch the imagination of young people, and plant a seed that will flower and come to fruition.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: The work never matches the dream of perfection the artist has to start with.
quotes.author: William Faulkner

quotes.quote: Begin with an individual, and before you know it you have created a type; begin with a type, and you find you have created-nothing.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.quote: Writing is its own reward.
quotes.author: Henry Miller

quotes.quote: The unread story is not a story; it is little black marks on wood pulp. The reader, reading it, makes it live: a live thing, a story.
quotes.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quotes.quote: Almost anyone can be an author; the business is to collect money and fame from this state of being.
quotes.author: A. A. Milne

quotes.quote: A wounded deer leaps the highest.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.quote: Only in men's imagination does every truth find an effective and undeniable existence. Imagination, not invention, is the supreme master of art as of life.
quotes.author: Joseph Conrad

quotes.quote: Literature is all, or mostly, about sex.
quotes.author: Anthony Burgess

quotes.quote: Writers are always selling somebody out.
quotes.author: Joan Didion

quotes.quote: Anecdotes don't make good stories. Generally I dig down underneath them so far that the story that finally comes out is not what people thought their anecdotes were about.
quotes.author: Alice Munro

quotes.quote: You learn by writing short stories. Keep writing short stories. The money's in novels, but writing short stories keeps your writing lean and pointed.
quotes.author: Larry Niven

quotes.quote: Everywhere I go I'm asked if I think the university stifles writers. My opinion is that they don't stifle enough of them.
quotes.author: Flannery O'Connor

quotes.quote: I can't write five words but that I change seven.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.quote: There's no such thing as writer's block. That was invented by people in California who couldn't write.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.quote: Writing is not necessarily something to be ashamed of, but do it in private and wash your hands afterwards.
quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

quotes.quote: The more closely the author thinks of why he wrote, the more he comes to regard his imagination as a kind of self-generating cement which glued his facts together, and his emotions as a kind of dark and obscure designer of those facts. Reluctantly, he comes to the conclusion that to account for his book is to account for his life.
quotes.author: Richard Wright

quotes.quote: No one can write decently who is distrustful of the reader's intelligence or whose attitude is patronizing.
quotes.author: E. B. White

quotes.quote: A poet can survive everything but a misprint.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Rejection slips, or form letters, however tactfully phrased, are lacerations of the soul, if not quite inventions of the devil, but there is no way around them.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: Fiction is about stuff that's screwed up.
quotes.author: Nancy Kress

quotes.quote: In general…there's no point in writing hopeless novels. We all know we're going to die; what's important is the kind of men and women we are in the face of this.
quotes.author: Anne Lamott

quotes.quote: Great is the art of beginning, but greater is the art of ending.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.quote: Tell the readers a story! Because without a story, you are merely using words to prove you can string them together in logical sentences.
quotes.author: Anne McCaffrey

quotes.quote: If science fiction is the mythology of modern technology, then its myth is tragic.
quotes.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quotes.quote: All the information you need can be given in dialogue.
quotes.author: Elmore Leonard

quotes.quote: Everybody walks past a thousand story ideas every day. The good writers are the ones who see five or six of them. Most people don't see any.
quotes.author: Orson Scott Card

quotes.quote: All the words I use in my stories can be found in the dictionary,it’s just a matter of arranging them into the right sentences.
quotes.author: Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: Exercise the writing muscle every day, even if it is only a letter, notes, a title list, a character sketch, a journal entry. Writers are like dancers, like athletes. Without that exercise, the muscles seize up.
quotes.author: Jane Yolen

quotes.quote: If you write one story, it may be bad; if you write a hundred, you have the odds in your favor.
quotes.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs

quotes.quote: Finishing a book is just like you took a child out in the back yard and shot it.
quotes.author: Truman Capote

quotes.quote: Have a time and place for everything, and do everything in its time and place, and you will not only accomplish more, but have far more leisure than those who are always hurrying.
quotes.author: Tyron Edwards

quotes.quote: Of course, fortune has its part in human affairs, but conduct is really much more important.
quotes.author: Jeanne Detourbey

quotes.quote: I am surprised nothing has been made of the fact that astronaut Neil Armstrong carried no sidearms when he landed on the moon.
quotes.author: Justice Arthur Goldberg

quotes.quote: I was chosen to speak today based on my senility.
quotes.author: Wendy Morgan

quotes.quote: Sports allow men to build up situations of emergency. What he then demands of himself is unnecessary achievement and unnecessary sacrifice. He artificially creates the tension that he has been spared by affluent society.
quotes.author: Viktor Frankl

quotes.quote: The lazy man gets round the sun as quickly as the busy one.
quotes.author: R. T. Wombat

quotes.quote: God Himself is not secure, having given man dominion over His works.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: Many a man that couldn't direct ye to th' drug store on th' corner when he was thirty will get a respectful hearin' when age has further impaired his mind.
quotes.author: Finley Peter Dunne

quotes.quote: It is the soul's duty to be loyal to its own desires.
quotes.author: Rebecca West

quotes.quote: God does not pay weekly, but he pays at the end.
quotes.author: Dutch proverb

quotes.quote: Spring is nature's way of saying, 'Let's party!'
quotes.author: Robin Williams

quotes.quote: No one really understands the grief or joy of another.
quotes.author: Franz Schubert

quotes.quote: A good marriage would be between a blind wife and a deaf husband.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.quote: I'm at the stage of life when if a girl says no to me I'm profoundly grateful to her.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.quote: It is an economic axiom as old as the hills that goods and services can be paid for only with goods and services.
quotes.author: Albert J. Nock

quotes.quote: Big sisters are the crabgrass in the lawn of life.
quotes.author: Charles Schulz

quotes.quote: We will be victorious if we have not forgotten how to learn.
quotes.author: Rosa Luxemburg

quotes.quote: I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.quote: Pedantry crams our heads with learned lumber and takes out brains to make room for it.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton
